item.title: ≠kainyatara and the Ostrich
item.summary: The Ostrich who ran away with #kainyatára and gave him as a husband to her daughter. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII. 30. 8628-8636). A story of the Early Race. The Ostrich snatches up ≠kainyatara and runs off with him. She sets him down next to her daughter 'Yolk' (or ≠kariten), introducing him as the girl's new husband because the two resemble each other so strongly.
item.comments: 1) p.8627v: |han≠kass'o heard this story from his maternal grandmother (≠kammi) and again, when he asked for it, from his mother (|xabbi-an) after his grandmother's death, 2) pp.8628v-8629v: see The reason why the ostrich does not click, 3) p.8629v: all living creatures (including beasts of prey) were formerly people, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-30
